Job Title: Manager/Sr. Manager Event Strategy

Location: San Francisco, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

Job Category

Marketing & Communications

Job Details

About Salesforce

We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.

Salesforce is the #1 CRM company and fastest-growing top 10 enterprise software company in the world. Forbes has named Salesforce to its "Most Innovative Companies" list for the past eight years, and the company was named "Innovator of the Decade" recently by the magazine. And did we mention we've been on Fortune's "Best Places to Work" list for the past twelve years? If you are interacting with a brand, like Adidas, Bank of America, Intuit, etc. Salesforce is likely to be powering it - facilitating more than 50 billion customer interactions a month for a global community of 150,000+ customers.

Salesforce Strategic Events produces the world's best technology events that are industry-leading, including Dreamforce, the largest software conference in the world. We also produce events across the US and globally to engage and activate our enthusiastic customers and prospects. Salesforce is seeking a hard-working Manager/Senior Manager, Experience Strategy to join our team.

As the Manager/Senior Manager, Experience Strategy at Salesforce, you will lead the development and execution of cloud and industry event experiences across our strategic event portfolio, encompassing both in person and virtual formats. Working closely with internal teams such as Event Operations, Ancillaries, and Content, you will shape immersive event experiences for flagship events like Dreamforce, CNX, TDX, TC, and World Tours. Your role is pivotal in driving awareness of new launches and products, generating buyer demand, and contributing to pipeline and ACV growth.

Roles & Responsibilities

Serve as a single point of contact for all event-related matters for Product Marketing, Product, and Sales, actively participating in Product/Industry business meetings to ensure alignment with launches and business priorities, including international teams.Collaborate on experience strategy for one or more event portfolios including World Tours, Paid User Conferences (Connections, TrailblazerDx, Tableau Conference), Virtual Events and Dreamforce, working cross-functionally to identify event vision, key experience framework, messaging/positioning, audience acquisition strategy. Prioritize key products, industries, and launch moments across events. Lead integrated quarterly planning calls with cloud/industry business leads across campaigns, field marketing, and product marketing to understand priorities and formulate/update a comprehensive event plan.Assist in determining the strategic presence for cloud/industry across the entire event portfolio, including campground, content, and ancillary allocations.Develop and maintain a comprehensive event calendar for specific cloud/industry initiatives.Create overviews and recaps for each event outlining Product/Industry presence, participation, and results, shared via designated channels and meetings.Collect and report on event performance metrics, providing insights on a regular basis.Present event updates and results to Strategic Events, PMM, Sales, and Product leadership on a regular basis.Identify and prioritize key products, industries, and launch moments across events. Work collaboratively across the strategic events team to organize support for your Product/Industry. Regularly partnering with content, ancillary events, third-party events, and event ops to source support. 

Qualifications

5 - 7 years of experience in marketing, preferably in the technology industry or events marketing.Experience with virtual events.Exceptional project and time management skills – highly organized, detail focused, results oriented, and accountable.Excellent interpersonal skills with a solid ability to deal professionally with senior executives, vendors, and team members at all levels of the organization. Willingness to travel as needed.

Accommodations

If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.

Posting Statement

At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at www.equality.com and explore our company benefits at www.salesforcebenefits.com.

Salesforce is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.

﻿Salesforce welcomes all.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

For California-based roles, the base salary hiring range for this position is $132,800 to $225,500.

Compensation offered will be determined by factors such as location, level, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Certain roles may be eligible for incentive compensation, equity, benefits. More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.salesforcebenefits.com.

Experience Level (if available): None
